metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28368 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Xen through 4.14.x allows guest OS administrators to obtain sensitive information (such as AES keys from outside the guest) via a side-channel attack on a power/energy monitoring interface, aka a "Platypus" attack. NOTE: there is only one logically independent fix: to change the access control for each such interface in Xen.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
